pages.text:
Contact Us
Have questions? Check out the helpful list of Commonly Asked Questions below.
You can also always reach us via phone, email or the contact form below.
Front Desk Hours
8 am – 5 pm daily
Address
Island Inn
3111 W. Gulf Drive
Sanibel, FL 33957
Phone & Email:
Phone:
239-472-1561
Toll Free:
800-851-5088
Email:
[email protected]
Email Us
Fill out our contact form and we will respond to your message within 24 hours (usually much faster, though)!
Name:
Phone:
Email:
Question/Request/Comment:
Your browser does not support JavaScript!. Please enable javascript in your browser in order to get form work properly.
Click here to read our Privacy Policy.
Do you have availability for my specific dates?
You can see real-time availability as well as pricing, pictures, descriptions and floor plans by going to
This Link
and entering your desired check in and check out dates as well as the number of quests in your party. Still have questions? Call us between 8 am-5 pm at
239-472-1561
and we will help you!
Are pets allowed? Are emotional support animals allowed?
Sorry, but the Island Inn is not pet or ESA friendly. A list of other properties that are pet friendly can be found on the Sanibel Captiva Chamber of Commerce website.
https://sanibel-island.sanibel-captiva.org/
Do you rent bikes?
Yes! Island Inn guests can rent bikes from our front desk and we have plenty, so no need to make a reservation for them. Bikes are $10 for 2 hours, $13 for 4 hours, $15 for 1 day, $20 for 2 days, $25 for 3 days and $40 for 1 week.
I have a reservation and will be arriving after 5 pm. What should I do?
Just call us at
239-472-1561
or email us at
[email protected]
and let us know that you will be arriving after front desk hours. Be sure to reference the last name the reservation is under, confirmation number, etc. We will then email you simple instructions.
Should I rent a car? Is there an airport shuttle to Sanibel?
We do not have a shuttle and we recommend that most guests rent a car, as you really need one if staying for more than a day or so.  Taxi service on the Island is limited and we really don’t have ride share services like Uber and Lyft.  If you do decide to take transportation from the airport to the Inn, this link may be helpful:
https://www.flylcpa.com/transportation
What time is check in and check out?
Check in time is 3 p.m. and Check out is 11 a.m.
I want to check a specific room type’s availability.
Go to
This Link
and enter your desired check in and check out dates as well as the number of guests in your party. If you do not see the specific option you are looking for, call us between 8 am-5 pm at
239-472-1561
and we will be happy to help!
How do I make a change to my current reservation?
If you booked your reservation through a 3rd party online travel agent like Expedia, Booking.com, Hotels.com, etc., you must contact them to make any modifications whatsoever. If you booked your reservation directly with the Island Inn either by calling us or through our website, then just call us between 8 am and 5 pm at
239-472-1561
and we will be sure to take care of whatever is needed.
Do I need to bring my own beach towels? Beach chairs? Umbrellas?
We have plenty of towels, so no need to bring your own. Beach chairs and umbrellas are also complimentary for our guests.
I am interested in hosting a wedding, family or group at the Inn.
For group or family reunion bookings it is best to call the Inn at
239-472-1561
Do you offer group rates for weddings or events? Discounts like AAA or AARP?
Sorry, but we do not. The lowest available rates can always be found on our website at
This Link
I have a current reservation and would like to send a package down for my stay.
Send the package to yourself, c/o Island Inn, 3111 W. Gulf Drive, Sanibel, FL 33957.  Have package arrive the day before your arrival and we will place in your accommodation on the day of your arrival.
I want to have groceries delivered on the day I arrive.
Go to
Jerry’s of Sanibel
or call them at
239-472-9300
. Request the order be delivered at 3 pm on the day of your arrival and be sure the last name on your hotel reservation is the same name referenced on the delivery. We will have the items placed in your accommodation once delivered.

Island Inn Gives
The Island Inn, built in 1895, is the most established Inn on Sanibel and Captiva and as such, is steeped in island history. Supporting island charities was part of the mission that began with the Inn’s founders, the Matthews family. Today, we carry on this same tradition and support a range of island charities and local events.
The Bailey-Matthews Shell Museum
Did you know that the Matthews family were the original owners of the Island Inn and founding partners of the the Bailey-Matthews National Shell Museum?  Maintaining this long established association, the Inn is a steadfast supporter of Sanibel Island’s finest museum.
The Bailey-Matthews National Shell Museum is a non-profit museum that focuses on education, awareness and research of shells, mollusks and the shell makers of Southwest Florida & the Gulf of America. With more than 30 exhibits of mollusks from Florida and around the world, a huge shell collection and tons of information about shells, it is a great way to spend a day on Sanibel Island.
See the Shell Museum
Captains For Clean Water
The Island Inn is a proud sponsor of the Captains for Clean Water, A grassroot organization advocating to restore the historic flow of clean, freshwater from Lake Okeechobee through the Everglades National Park and into Florida Bay. This will not only elminate the need for damaging freshwater releases to the St Lucie and Caloosahatchee estuaries, but provide freshwater flow to Florida Bay, where it is desperately needed. Water storage, treatment, and convenience sough of Lake Okeechobee in what is known as the Everglads Agrigultural are is the reolution to thie man-made issue. Check out the Captains weblpage and find out how you can help South Florida’s world-class ecosystems!
Captains for Clean Water
Sanibel-Captiva Fireworks Celebration
The Island Inn is a major sponsor of Sanibel Island’s 4th of July fireworks celebration, which is presented by the Chamber of Commerce, along with many other Chamber programs and events.  The Island Inn is appreciative of the hard work and dedication the Sanibel-Captiva Chamber of Commerce displays in offering a first-class welcome to our islands.
Explore Sanibel Captiva
Annual 10K Race for F.I.S.H.
The Island Inn is proud to be a sponsor of the Annual 10K Race for F.I.S.H. (Friends in Service Here). FISH is the island’s human services organization and the race is its main fundraising event. Held every year on Sanibel it attracts more than 500 runners.
F.I.S.H. is a non-profit volunteer organization assisting Sanibel and Captiva islanders and visitors with a wide range of services including a food pantry, a daily hot meals program and emergency financial assistance for those in need.
Learn More about F.I.S.H
J.N. Ding Darling National Wildlife Refuge: Sea Turtle Preservation Mission
J.N. “Ding” Darling National Wildlife Refuge: Sea Turtle Preservation Mission:
The Island Inn has pledged to assist “Ding” Darling in their Sea Turtle Preservation Mission. The Mission educates guests and residents about the protection of the different species of sea turtles that nest on Sanibel and Captiva Islands and their significance for the local ecosystem. The Island Inn helps to distribute educational materials, informational brochures and children’s activity booklets to resort guests.
See the Refuge Site
CROW’s Animal Ambassador: Trouper, the Blind Raccoon
CROW is the Clinic for Rehabilitation of Wildlife. CROW operates a veterinary hospital, an educational program and a public visitor education center. CROW’s primary mission is the rescue, care, rehabilitation and eventual release back to the wild of sick, injured and orphaned wildlife. A key part of this mission is the education of adults and children, encouraging them to live in peaceful coexistence with their wild neighbors.
See the Clinic Website
Panther Baseball Alumni Club
The Panther Baseball Alumni Club is a local non-profit organization that raises funds to support the local Cypress Lake High School baseball team, which many Sanibel residents attend. Cash raised goes to provide supplies and college scholarships to promising high school student athletes who excel in sports, academics and in their respective communities. The Island Inn is one of the main sponsors and organizers of their major fundraising events.
Meet the Panthers
Other Island Inn Donations
In addition to the organizations listed, the Island Inn donated over $18,000 in goods and services to other local charities and organizations this year, they included:
Sanibel-Captiva Conservation Foundation
Sanibel-Captiva Island Lions Club
Sanibel-Captiva Optimist Club
IMAG- History & Science Center
Sanibel Island Fishing Club
City of Sanibel’s Financial Assistance Program
Children’s Education Center of the Islands
Lee Memorial Health System Foundation
Sanibel Historical Museum & Village
Children Organ Transplant Association
United Way of Lee County Inc.
Florida Gulf Coast University
Luminary Stroll On Sanibel & Captiva Islands
*Employees of the Island Inn also donate to United Way of Lee County directly from their paychecks, through an authorized tax free program, administered by Island Inn.

Visitor Reviews
Amazing Inn at Sanibel
Third time staying in Sanibel. This hotel (or Inn) is amazing. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The room is amazing. Huge space, nice kitchen and supplies, balcony with a lot of chairs and table to sit and relax. King size bed was great and bathroom has 2 sinks - identical as photos. They offer 1 covered parking spot (in the summer or raining season, this make a difference). The Inn is right at the beach, in a private and nice place at Sanibel - away from the public beach area. My wife loved shelling in peace and found several shells to her collection. They offer chairs/umbrella at no cost. And bikes for rentals. Cleaning staff was great and service everyday. I stayed in Matthews Lodge Luxury suites. They offer the Starky Lodge studios too, but is smaller (but has 2 queen beds).
read more
read less
Artur
8/22/2025
A “MUST” stay!!
We LOVE Island Inn! Ken and Glory and so welcoming.  This is our second time returning.  The units are right on the beach and have everything you would ever want.  We rented bikes and paddle boards and had so much fun. The screened in porches are so lovely and the view is amazing.  Wonderful shelling right outside; as well as free beach chairs and umbrellas.  Highly recommend!  We will be back!
read more
read less
map1971
8/10/2025
Wonderful and close to the beach.
Everything needed is available and the proximity to the beach is the best. We rarely ate out since we could cook our own meals. Chairs are set up for guests every day and towels are provided. We always enjoy our stay here!
read more
read less

About Island Inn
Discover Our Sanibel Hotel & Florida Beach Resort
Perched on Sanibel’s stunning south shore with miles of white sandy beaches alongside our 10 acre beachfront property, dotted with lush landscaping and towering coconut palms, the quaint Island Inn beachfront resort serves island adventure and relaxation. Conveniently located on the Gulf of America, just a short drive from Southwest Florida International Airport; this Sanibel hotel is perfect for Florida vacations, getaways & events year-round. Cherished Memories, Modern Comforts – Enjoy It All at the Island Inn!

Tranquility
I usually travel alone and I felt completely safe at the Island Inn.  The inn is clean and well cared for, everything is in tip-top condition!  In addition, the employees were all very kind.  The free use of the umbrellas and beach chairs are the icing on the cake!  Some other resorts on the island charge you $$ to sit under an umbrella.
